The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians

Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus, to all the ones set apart in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the overseers and deacons.
I thank my God with every thought of you, I give thanks for your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now. Every time I pray for you, it is always a prayer of joy.
If there is therefore any encouragement in Christ, if any comfort from his love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any tender mercies and compassions,

Do nothing through selfishness or empty pride, but instead in lowliness of mind count others better than yourself. make my joy full so that you are of the same mind, have the same love, are united in spirit, and have the same purpose.
